statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

article.description: Jay Bowie hit the game winner as Marist scored five points in the final seven seconds to steal a 65-64 victory from Siena on Friday night.
article.shortLinkText: Marist scores 5 in final seconds to stun Siena
article.headline: Marist scores 5 in final 7 seconds to stun Siena
article.linkText: Marist scores 5 in final seconds to stun Siena
article.story:
POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y. -- Jay Bowie hit the game winner as Marist scored five points in the final seven seconds to steal a 65-64 victory from Siena on Friday night.

Lavon Long made two free throws for Siena to extend its lead to 64-60 with 12 seconds to go before Chavaughn Lewis went the length of the court in only five seconds for a layup to cut the deficit to two.

Bowie then intercepted Brett Bisping's inbounds pass and made a 3-pointer with three seconds left to win the game.

Marist (10-15, 7-8 Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference) trailed 62-57 when Khallid Hart made a 3-pointer with 16 seconds left.

Adam Kemp had 15 points and 15 rebounds while Hart led Marist with 16 points and three 3-pointers. Lewis added 14 points, and Bowie had 10.

Marquis Wright had 20 points to lead Siena (11-15, 7-8), and Long had 13 points and 11 rebounds.
